sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine marks its national flag day, but President Zelenskyy bans public celebration as the country braces for more Russian attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is in Canada for talks focused on boosting energy security for Europe's largest economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: security for Europe's largest economy. And the euro drops to a 20-year low against the U.S. dollar as worries persist over the global economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine shows off captured Russian armored vehicles before a city curfew in Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelensky has has banned rallies marking the country's two annual celebrations â€“ today's National Flag Day and Independence Day on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine fears an escalation of Russian attacks following the killing of the daughter of one of Vladimir Putin's allies in a car bombing near Moscow at the weekend. Dear Ukrainians, especially these days when we celebrate the day of our flag and the day of our independence, if you are somewhere abroad, please remind others about Ukraine there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Be there with the Ukrainian flag and spread the truth about the crimes of the occupiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The death toll in Russian rocket attacks on hostile dormitories in Ukraine's second largest city of Kharkiv last week has risen to 25.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The rescue operation ended on Monday with eight bodies still unidentified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Around 40 injured are recovering in hospitals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On the military front, almost 9,000 Ukrainian soldiers have been killed since Russia launched its invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's the first time Ukraine's revealed the scale of its military losses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, under the threat of Russian attacks and a war that stopped all football in Ukraine, a new league season starts today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: All games in the 16-team league will be played in and around Kiev and further west.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: If the sirens sound, players must dash to bomb shelters in the 16-team league will be played in and around Kyiv and further west. If the sirens sound, players must dash to bomb shelters in the stadiums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has met with representatives from 40 nations and the leaders of the European Union and NATO for the second summit of Crimea platform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The meeting is intended to put pressure on Russia over its annexation of Crimea in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A spotlight has been shown on the peninsula in recent weeks after a series of blasts at Russian military sites.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On July 31st, a drone attack on Russia's Black Sea naval headquarters injured five people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A Russian ammunition depot was later hit by an explosion and six months after the beginning and estimated nine war planes were reportedly destroyed at a Russian air base to come together with partners the meeting comes the day before the six month anniversary of the war in Ukraine August 23rd also holds a symbolic meaning it is Ukraine's National Flag Day, followed by Ukraine's Independence Day on the 24th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's been... Thank you. Thank you, Mr. President.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At a somber ceremony in Moscow, hundreds of people, roses in hand, lined up to say farewell to Darina Dugina, the assassinated daughter of Russian nationalist Alexander Dugin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: She was killed when a remotely controlled device blew up her car.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Her father was believed to be the target.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He framed her death as part of a struggle for Russian power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The highest price one has to pay can be redeemed only by the highest achievement, our victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: She lived for this victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: She died in the name of this victory, our Russian victory, our truth, our Orthodox faith, our country, our state. days. However, a Russian MP went further, accusing Ukraine of killing Degina.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Both the executioners and masterminds are in Kiev, and one of the masterminds is Mr.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Zelensky personally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He will inescapably face the international tribunal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The fascist scum must be annihilated in its lair. The lair is in Kiev, and the complete denazification of Ukraine is impossible without liquidation of the criminal fascist regime of Zelensky. Russian intelligence has blamed their counterparts in Kiev for carrying out the killing, releasing these photos of a Ukrainian woman who allegedly followed Degina for days and subsequently fled to Estonia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine has hit back at accusations it was involved, saying that it was in fact Moscow secret service, the FSB, who carried it out, to keep Russians motivated to continue the war effort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Amid the shock and heartbreak for many in nationalist circles, calls are now growing to ramp up strikes against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is hoping to strike gold on the second day of his Canadian tour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine in February, Berlin has been scrambling to find alternatives to Russian oil and gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Before the war, Europe's largest economy depended on Moscow for just under a third of its natural gas needs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now it is looking for new suppliers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Scholz is travelling to the island of Newfoundland with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to inspect the site of a future wind farm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Berlin wants to give Canada the technology to build a hydrogen plant that creates clean, renewable energy, not just to counter Russia's energy dominance, but also to help the German and Canadian economies reach carbon neutrality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: To stop man-made climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We know that this requires high-tech answers that we want to achieve, but we want to offer globally competitive products and services, but at the same time we want to operate in a CO2-neutral way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is a very special task that requires the highest level of competence, but we believe that if we move this forward closer together, we'll be able to do just that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Clean energy is an issue that's more important than ever because of the threats posed by climate change, but also because of the threats posed by climate change, but also because of Russia's war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Germany's current energy crisis, however, won't be solved by this hydrogen deal alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In return, Scholz and his foreign minister, Robert Habeck, want to firm up access to Canadian liquefied natural gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Trudeau says he's exploring the possibility of a trade agreement, but has cautioned he can't guarantee it will be feasible. New port infrastructure and pipelines will be needed to transport liquefied natural gas across the Atlantic, which rules out direct shipments to European ports in the short term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The euro fell below parity with the US dollar on Monday for the second time this year, sinking to levels not seen since it was first introduced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The currency fell by as much as 0.9%, meaning it's now trading at levels last seen in 2002.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It comes as the eurozone faces rising inflation amid fears of an energy crisis this winter, as Russia threatens to squeeze its gas deliveries to the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the dollar rose 0.8% to a more than five-week high, evidence of the diverging fortunes of the European and US economies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The euro briefly fell below parity in mid-July for the first time in 20 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Italy, core inflation excluding energy has jumped to 4.1%. As Italy heads to the polls next month, candidates will be forced to reckon with the cost of living crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The far-right brothers of Italy in coalition with Forza Italia and the League of Parity are expected to come out top, with Giorgia Meloni set to become the next prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Our correspondent, Giorgia Orlandi, has more from Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For the first time in 100 years, Italy's general elections will be held in autumn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: By 8pm on Monday, all main political parties had to submit their official candidate list.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Now the electoral campaign, which is going to last a month, officially gets underway THE ELECTRICAL PARTY HAD TO SUBMIT THEIR OFFICIAL CANDIDATELY.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: THE ELECTRICAL CAMPAIGN, WHICH IS GOING TO LAST A MONTH, OFFICIALLY GETS UNDERWAY THIS WEEK, YOU CAN TELL BY THE CAMPAIGN POSTERS THAT YOU CAN SEE HERE IN ROME.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: BUT THE CITY IS UNUSUALLY EMPTY. THAT IS BECAUSE MOST ITALIANS ARE STILL ON HOLIDAY. SO THIS SCENARIO IS WHAT AWAITS THEM WHEN THEY COME BACK TO ITALY'S CAPITAL AS WELL AS TO OTHER CITIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY. AMONG THE MAIN THEMES OF THESE when they come back to Italy's capital as well as to other cities across the country. Now, among the main themes of these electoral campaigns, there is the energy crisis, inflation, migration and the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Two main coalitions will be confronting each other on all these issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: One is the centre-left and the other one is the one led by the right-wing party, the Broaders of Italy, which also includes Sivo Berlusconi's Forza Italia and Matteo Salvini's League Party, which according to recent polls is expected to get a clear majority at the next elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Although it's still a long way to go and anything can happen between now and the 25th of September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Giorgia Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.
